title: Chicago Cubs Font
content:
I'm making a tee-shirt for a local group event (The Emmaus walk) and the design is similar to the Chicago Cubs logo.  
 [http://www.thesportsbros.com/images/categories/MLB\_Cubs.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049/http:/www.thesportsbros.com/images/categories/MLB_Cubs.gif "http://www.thesportsbros.com/images/categories/MLB\_Cubs.gif")  
I read this: [http://wiki.answers.com/Q/What\_font\_do\_the\_Chicago\_Cubs\_use\_in\_their\_logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049/http:/wiki.answers.com/Q/What_font_do_the_Chicago_Cubs_use_in_their_logo "http://wiki.answers.com/Q/What\_font\_do\_the\_Chicago\_Cubs\_use\_in\_their\_logo")  
which says,"The Exact font is Century Gothic Bold."  
Unless I'm completely mistaken, that is completely wrong.

Could you please tell me what font is really used?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MLB_Cubs_6520.gif)
author: KevinBrown

comments.content: It's likely hand drawn, but the "UBS" is very similar to [Neographik](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/neographik_std_regular/?sample_text=UBS&sample_size=144).
You can find a similar 'C' in [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mark_simonson/proxima_nova_extrabold/?sample_text=C&sample_size=288).

Thanks! I'm very impressed with this forums. Its great to find a place full of happy, helpful people!  
\*I know this is unprofessional, but is there a free substitute?
Nope. (I mean that in a friendly way.)

It's not an exact match for 'UBS', but I think you might find useful  
 **[Not A Number](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049/http:/www.subflux.com/Fonts/FontsRecre_Not.htm)** by [Mickey Rossi](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223160049/http:/www.subflux.com/Fonts/Fonts.htm).
